title: PHPis_writable()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPis_writable()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Check whether the specified filename is writable:
<?php
$file = "test.txt";
if(is_writable($file)) {
echo ("$file is writable");
}
else {
echo ("$file is not writable");
}
?>
The output of the code above could be:
test.txt is writable
Definition and Usage
The is_writable() function checks whether the specified filename is writable.
Note:
The result of this function is cached. Use
clearstatcache()
to clear the cache.
Syntax
is_writable(
file
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
file
Required. Specifies the path to the file to check
Technical Details
Return Value:
TRUE if the file is writable, an 
 E_WARNING on failure
PHP Version:
4.0+

★
+1

You'll learn how to use PHPis_writable()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples.
